data.meta_description:
The hot standby communications system includes 
switching means (9) interposed between two communicaÂ­
tion equipments (4, 5) to branch a received input to two 
different powers. One of the powers which is greater than the 
other is routed to one of the communications equipments 
which is to be used as a regular equipment (4) with no regard 
to whether it has initially been a regular equipment or not. 
The other or smaller power is routed to the other comÂ­
munications equipment which is to be used as a protection 
equipment (5) with no regard to whether it has initially been 
a protection equipment or not. This system has a simple 
construction and allows a minimum of deterioration to occur 
in communications quality despite the distribution of a 
power to a protection equipment which is at the standby.

Abstract

The hot standby communications system includes switching means (9) interposed between two communicaÂ­ tion equipments (4, 5) to branch a received input to two different powers. One of the powers which is greater than the other is routed to one of the communications equipments which is to be used as a regular equipment (4) with no regard to whether it has initially been a regular equipment or not. The other or smaller power is routed to the other comÂ­ munications equipment which is to be used as a protection equipment (5) with no regard to whether it has initially been a protection equipment or not. This system has a simple construction and allows a minimum of deterioration to occur in communications quality despite the distribution of a power to a protection equipment which is at the standby.
